page.title: 01HASTINGS IN 1985
page.content: The town has a population of 75 000 in 1985. Hastings has a long history but grew rapidly after the railway led to the development of tourism. Today tourism is still important but the economy is diversified. Many people have retired to the area. New industries have been established providing employment for the younger people of the town. Some people travel to London to work each day. Unemployment is higher than other places in the South East. However many young people still leave the town to look for work.
